column1: Why is Roger 's face so red and flushed ? [SEP] He took a deep breath and unlocked the door . Roger pulled out the door and simply stepped in and locked it again . John was surprised , Roger did n't seem to be angry with him . " I 'm so sorry , I do n't know why I did that , I must be out of my mind and ... " John was interrupted by Roger 's tongue in his mouth , curiously seeking around in there . John felt both surprised and pleased at the same time , and answered Roger 's kiss . When they broke the contact , John could n't say anything except a simple " .. why ? " Roger blushed and shrugged his shoulders . [SEP]  (A) Roger just got dumped . (B) Roger is fearful for his job . (C) Roger got kissed by John . (D) Roger is worried about something .
column2: Roger got kissed by John .

column1: What is the speaker trying to do ? [SEP] If someone points out something substantive I can fix in the analysis , I will try to clean it up . First , read this . This page gives a good discussion of a liquidity crisis in corporate finance . A macroeconomic " high finance " liquidity crisis is essentially the same thing , only happening with large banks . As in everything in high finance , high - finance liquidity crises are more complex . One key reason high - finance liquidity crises are much more complex and potentially disastrous than regular corporate liquidity crises is the meshed nature of the problem . [SEP]  (A) They are teaching their coworkers about liquidation . (B) They are trying to give a presentation at work . (C) They are trying to teach others about macroeconomics . (D) None of the above choices .
column2: They are trying to teach others about macroeconomics .

column1: What may happen if i was more sociable ? [SEP] I do n't think I did the greatest job at networking , but I tried a bit . I ' m just not naturally a social person and it 's rather difficult for me to talk with people I do n't know very well . ( I could have used The Alternative Scientist 's Guide To Networking , but , alas , it was mostly posted while I was away . ) [SEP]  (A) I would feel like an outcast . (B) None of the above choices . (C) I would be disliked . (D) I would be criticized .
column2: None of the above choices .

column1: why is he depressed about heath ? [SEP] I just got back from seeing The Dark Knight , and it was awesome ! ! ! I have such a Batman fetish and I love Christian Bale . It 's still really depressing to think about Heath Ledger though . He was amazing as the Joker . [SEP]  (A) Heath took drugs (B) Heath took another role as joker (C) Heath passed away (D) None of the above choices .
column2: Heath passed away

column1: What may be the reason that the couple remains ? [SEP] Most of my friends who ' ve lived here have moved away . But one couple remains : my rescued tough - guy robin and his wife , a faithful bird - of - valor whose tireless mud - gathering has afforded them TWO NESTS each nesting season since assuming ownership of the back yard . This week their exuberant presence dominated the yard , each of them taking turns at hunting squirmy prey , taking vigorous baths in the birdbath , following me almost literally " under foot . " [SEP]  (A) They are trying to make friends . (B) They are being taken care of . (C) They do n't want to be lonely . (D) They are trapped .
column2: They are being taken care of .

column1: What are the kids working on ? [SEP] All while the kids video the next amazing stunt for YouTube in the backyard . Bad things happen to good people all the time . Because the real world is n't fair . Things cost you in the real world . [SEP]  (A) None of the above choices . (B) They are finishing their schoolwork for the week (C) They are teaching the dog to shake (D) They are hard at work creating a video
column2: They are hard at work creating a video

column1: How do I feel taking care of this infant that just refuses to fall sleep ? [SEP] Her usual 3 hour nap yesterday lasted an hour and all her naps following ( not as many as usual ) were very short so naturally she was over tired . It was imfreakinpossible to get her to nurse without the shield or to fall asleep after like 5 . She finally fell asleep in the bouncer for a half hour at 9 but that only lasted a half hour . [SEP]  (A) I feel completely fine about all this . (B) None of the above choices . (C) I feel great about this . (D) I feel content and happy .
column2: None of the above choices .

column1: Why may the narrator be having headaches ? [SEP] I echoed the sea theme with the frame , using eyelets and cord to look like rope at the bottom . I had my MRI scan today - which was fine apart from the fact I had to lie flat on my back for 20 minutes and I do n't do flat on my back ! Due to a back injury when I was 12 I have a curved back and out of kilter pelvis and so it was hell trying to lie flat for that long . But tis done now and I await results . [SEP]  (A) None of the above choices . (B) They have a head injury . (C) They have gotten punched . (D) They have gotten into a scrap .
column2: They have a head injury .

column1: Why are the scientists so excited about Graphene ? [SEP] Graphene looks like it 's going to be one of the " wonder materials " of the future , and a science team at Cornell University have just demonstrated the world 's smallest balloon made of it . [SEP]  (A) The scientists believe the material is cheap and effective . (B) The scientists believe the material is cost - effective . (C) The scientists believe that the material is light . (D) The scientists believe it is good for armor .
column2: The scientists believe that the material is light .

column1: What sporting event will be held a the end of the season ? [SEP] Wow Detroit actually managed a win , so now they ca n't go winless in the second half of the season . Albeit it was against KC who pretty much blow some of the biggest donkey dick imaginable , and we almost managed to do what we 're famous for . But suprisingly we were able to hold out for the win . The Patriots won again and are now 1 game away from a perfect season . [SEP]  (A) The World Series will be played . (B) None of the above choices . (C) The Super Bowl will be played . (D) Hockey Finals will be played .
column2: The Super Bowl will be played .

column1: What may be a plausible fact of the statistics ? [SEP] Stats Canada : Private radio broadcasters ' advertising revenue advanced 6.0 % to $ 1.5 billion ( current dollars ) , outpacing advertising market growth as a whole for the third time in five years . The industry 's financial success during the recent past was due largely to economic growth and industry restructuring . Among other things , regulatory changes in 1998 allowed for greater concentration of ownership , which helped radio withstand the competition from other media . The industry also rationalized its operations by transferring AM stations to the generally more popular and more profitable FM band . FM radio played a predominant role in the industry 's results . [SEP]  (A) The statistics are about a country in North America . (B) The statistics are about a country in Europe . (C) None of the above choices . (D) The statistics are about a country in South America .
column2: The statistics are about a country in North America .

column1: Why is the narrator being so hostile to others in the dialogue ? [SEP] " Shut up , you berk . This is a dream . I can do whatever you want me to . In fact , I ' m doing what you want right now . " " Oh . " Howard analysed the situation . [SEP]  (A) None of the above choices . (B) The narrator is dreaming and does not want objections . (C) The narrator is dreaming and wants to be fun . (D) The narrator is dreaming and wants to be kind .
column2: The narrator is dreaming and does not want objections .

column1: What would have happened if everyone was frantic ? [SEP] I have to say the building felt amazingly calm , the usual frantic energy of Getting It All Done before the end came just was n't there . And everyone seemed just a little ... nicer I think . The crowd was slow to get up to any kind of speed and even then it was a nice easy lope . [SEP]  (A) we would calmly get it all done fast (B) None of the above choices . (C) a feeling of less calm and hurry would be on us (D) to busy to get it all done
column2: a feeling of less calm and hurry would be on us

column1: Why was I getting pulled over and the other 2 people being pulled over at the same area ? [SEP] While I was sitting there , another guy got pulled over a block behind me . On the way back home , I saw a cop race ahead of me and pull over another person . [SEP]  (A) Police stop people because there is a fire in the area and they want to keep people away . (B) The area is what is called a " speed trap " meaning police try to focus on a vulnerable or certain part of the road and try to ticket people . (C) None of the above choices . (D) Police pull people over because they think a fugitive may be in their auto .
column2: The area is what is called a " speed trap " meaning police try to focus on a vulnerable or certain part of the road and try to ticket people .

column1: Why would the narrator be consuming so much protein ? [SEP] I am having a pretty good day today . I was up at about 8 am and had a protein shake and went back to sleep until about 12:30pm . I ' ve been up since and had another protein shake . I ' m about to work on a diet Snapple . [SEP]  (A) The narrator is a vegan . (B) The narrator is fighting a deficiency . (C) The narrator loves shakes . (D) The narrator is looking to build muscle .
column2: The narrator is looking to build muscle .

column1: What is the reason it took 20 or 30 minutes to get a box of cereal ? [SEP] I end up taking a look at every single aisle . So it should surprise no one that it took me 20 - 30 minutes before I left the store with a box of cereal in my hands . However , I believe it was productive as it gave me mental composure : D Also , I saw a jar of roasted red pepper ! [SEP]  (A) I looked at all the aisles . (B) I was unable to find what I needed . (C) I got lost in the store . (D) None of the above choices .
column2: I looked at all the aisles .

column1: What may happen after they overhear their uncle and sister talking ? [SEP] I make it a point not to discuss politics at family functions . It 's not worth the aggravation . However , I could n't let this one pass by when I overheard my uncle and my sister talking . [SEP]  (A) They confront them with their fists . (B) They confront them with a hug . (C) They confront them and an argument ensues . (D) They confront them and start crying .
column2: They confront them and an argument ensues .

column1: Why is the narrator so excited about Summer coming to an end ? [SEP] I ' m on the eve of summer being over . Believe it or not , as much as I enjoy vacations , this is also my favorite part of school , that moment of anticipation just before . The whole semester is in front of me , four months of opportunities . There will also be that chance just before school starts to get things in order in the apartment that , barring any incident like this last one will be my home for the next two years . Moving day was last Saturday . [SEP]  (A) The narrator looks forward to going to the beach . (B) The narrator looks forward to learning new things . (C) None of the above choices . (D) The narrator looks forward to going to work .
column2: The narrator looks forward to learning new things .

column1: What may happen after they reunite ? [SEP] Stalling out , skipping class , screaming in the car about how fuckin ' cool we are , laughing at Endi in biology class , driving through rain , driving on the WRONG side of the road , planning our futures so delicately , over analyzing everything , hugging the right lane , sneakin ' up to my bathroom , having the worst possible things in our purses , 8 charges , and LOVING YOU . It 's so nice to have my best friend back . It 's so nice to have a constant . [SEP]  (A) They will steal with each other again . (B) They will get arrested again . (C) They will get into mischief again . (D) None of the above choices .
column2: They will get into mischief again .

column1: Why was cleaning fridges for the first time in two years so difficult ? [SEP] With the always nagging voice in my head reminding me that i do n't have money , i was freaking out because i thought that i would miss the fair this year . I called my mother and asked her if there was anything that i could do for petty cash around the house . She gave me the job of cleaning out the two fridges , which i thought would be easy . After starting my job , i soon realize that these fridges have not been cleaned out for AT LEAST 2 years or so . [SEP]  (A) Since it had been so long , this task would require a lot of elbow grease (B) No one had used the fridge for two years and it was full of moldy food (C) The last housekeeper had quit two years ago precisely because the fridge was so dirty (D) None of the above choices .
column2: Since it had been so long , this task would require a lot of elbow grease

column1: What may I like yo do in my spare time ? [SEP] I had a little time on my hands last week and finally made a couple of collages that I ' ve had in my mind for a while now . The idea was to build a collage directly on a piece of 8x10 watercolor paper . The watercolor paper is strong , has a good texture , is a pretty color , and acts as a mat for the collage . [SEP]  (A) Art (B) Shopping (C) None of the above choices . (D) Partying
column2: Art

column1: What may be the reason for the pillow fight ? [SEP] He was probably a bit overstimulated today , but he 's handled the transition very well so far I think . The glass shroud hit my head and broke , and also managed to give me a pretty wicked cut on my head . It was n't quite bad enough to need stitches , but the glass shroud was thick enough that I ' m just glad it did n't actually bust my skull open . [SEP]  (A) To get back at each other . (B) To ruin their friendship . (C) To injure each other . (D) To be playful .

column1: Why is the narrator feeling so nostalgic ? [SEP] I do n't know why , but upon seeing that picture and newsletter , I smiled back . It 's not like I suddenly agreed with her policies . Maybe it was because I knew she would be resigning at the end of this academic year , or maybe it was because of the sudden excitement that just holding the newsletter had filled me with . Okay , I must admit , I am a dork , like a HUGE dork but I felt as excited as if I were a freshman about to embark on my very first year of college , alone , independent , FREE ! ! [SEP]  (A) They are thinking of sporting matches freshman year . (B) They are thinking of a time previously as an academic . (C) None of the above choices . (D) They are thinking of their first year teaching the freshman .
column2: They are thinking of a time previously as an academic .

column1: Why does the doctor 's sadness lead the speaker to believe something terrible must have happened to him ? [SEP] They just dumped me here and left . " This Doctor was different . Charley knew all about regenerations and how they could change him , but this Doctor had sadness written all over his face , a far cry from her Doctor who greeted everyone as if they were old friends , even if they have never met . Something terrible must have happened to him . " The CIA were never the friendliest of people " . [SEP]  (A) The speaker has a baseline degree of empathy which indicates to them that the doctor has suffered (B) The speaker is an expert at reading body language and does so towards the doctor (C) The speaker recognizes the doctor from a public hearing about CIA abuses (D) He is verbally communicating how horrible the CIA had treated him
column2: The speaker has a baseline degree of empathy which indicates to them that the doctor has suffered

column1: What may happen during these hardships ? [SEP] It 's been a difficult Summer . Though my faith can never be broken , it is fragile and fragmented . I have no doubts that it is real or it is good , but things conspire to undermine it : my father 's ill - health and imminent decline , my love / hate relationship with my mother , my husband 's fragile nature and dissatisfaction with his current lot in life , my own mid - life concerns and little plagues , a good friend 's grave illness - serious lack of sleep . [SEP]  (A) They will help out those close to them that are suffering . (B) None of the above choices . (C) They will work as many hours at their job as possible . (D) They will spend a lot of money due to their father 's illness .
column2: They will help out those close to them that are suffering .

column1: Why does the narrator feel so knowledgeable about ethical matters ? [SEP] If you have taken any of Beth Moore 's bible studies or heard her speak you have probably heard this story .
